00001 /**************************************************************
00002   JLex: A Lexical Analyzer Generator for Java(TM)
00003   Written by Elliot Berk <ejberk@cs.princeton.edu>. Copyright 1996.
00004   Maintained by C. Scott Ananian <cananian@alumni.princeton.edu>.
00005   See below for copyright notice, license, and disclaimer.
00006   New releases from http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~appel/modern/java/JLex/
00007 
00008   Version 1.2.6, 2/7/03, [C. Scott Ananian]
00009    Renamed 'assert' function 'ASSERT' to accomodate Java 1.4's new keyword.
00010    Fixed a bug which certain forms of comment in the JLex directives section
00011      (which are not allowed) to be incorrectly parsed as macro definitions.
00012   Version 1.2.5, 7/25/99-5/16/00, [C. Scott Ananian]
00013    Stomped on one more 8-bit character bug.  Should work now (really!).
00014    Added unicode support, including unicode escape sequences.
00015    Rewrote internal JavaLexBitSet class as SparseBitSet for efficient
00016      unicoding.
00017    Added an NFA character class simplification pass for unicode efficiency.
00018    Changed byte- and stream-oriented I/O routines to use characters and
00019      java.io.Reader and java.io.Writer instead --- which means we read in
00020      unicode specifications correctly and write out a proper unicode java
00021      source file.  As a happy side-effect, the output java file is written
00022      with your platform's preferred newline character(s).
00023    Rewrote CInput to fix bugs with line-counting in the specification file
00024      and "unusual behaviour" when the last line of the specification wasn't
00025      terminated with a newline. Thanks to Matt Hanna <mhanna@cs.caltech.edu>
00026      for pointing out the bug.
00027    Fixed a bug that would cause JLex not to terminate given certain input
00028      specifications.  Thanks to Mark Greenstreet <mrg@cs.ubc.ca> and
00029      Frank B. Brokken <frank@suffix.icce.rug.nl> for reporting this.
00030    CUP parser integration improved according to suggestions made by
00031      David MacMahon <davidm@smartsc.com>.  The %cup directive now tells
00032      JLex to generate a parser conforming to the java_cup.runtime.Scanner
00033      interface; see manual for more details.
00034    Fixed bug with null string literals ("") in regexps.  Reported by
00035      Charles Fischer <fischer@cs.wisc.edu>.
00036    Rewrote start-of-line and end-of-line handling, closing active bug #5.
00037      Also fixed line-counting code, closing active bug #12.  All
00038      new-line handling is now platform-independent.
00039    Used unpackFromString more extensively to allow larger cmap, etc,
00040      tables.  This helps unicode support work reliably.  It's also
00041      prettier now if you happen to read the source to the generated
00042      lexer.
00043    Generated lexer now accepts unicode LS (U+2028) and PS (U+2029) as
00044      line separators for strict unicode compliance; see
00045      http://www.unicode.org/unicode/reports/tr18/
00046    Fixed bug with character constants in action strings.  Reported by
00047      Andrew Appel against 1.2.5b3.
00048    Fixed bug with illegal \^C-style escape sequences.  Reported by
00049      Toshiya Iwai <iwai@isdnet.co.jp> against 1.2.5b4.
00050    Fixed "newline in quoted string" error when unpaired single- or
00051      double-quotes were present in comments in the action phrase.
00052      Reported by Stephen Ostermiller <1010JLex@ostermiller.com>
00053      against 1.2.5b4.  Reported by Eric Esposito <eric.esposito@unh.edu>
00054      against 1.2.4 and 1.2.5b2.
00055    Fixed "newline in quoted string" error when /* or // appeared
00056      in quoted strings in the action phrase.  Reported by
00057      David Eichmann <david-eichmann@uiowa.edu> against 1.2.5b5.
00058    Fixed 'illegal constant' errors in case statements caused by
00059      Sun's JDK 1.3 more closely adhering to the Java Language
00060      Specification.  Reported by a number of people, but 
00061      Harold Grovesteen <hgrovesteen@home.com> was the first to direct me to
00062      a Sun bug report (4119776) which quoted the relevant section of the
00063      JLS (15.27) to convince me that the JLex construction actually was
00064      illegal.  Reported against 1.2.5b6, but this bit of code has been
00065      present since the very first version of JLex (1.1.1).
00066 
00067   Version 1.2.4, 7/24/99, [C. Scott Ananian]
00068    Correct the parsing of '-' in character classes, closing active 
00069      bug #1.  Behaviour follows egrep: leading and trailing dashes in
00070      a character class lose their special meaning, so [-+] and [+-] do
00071      what you would expect them to.
00072    New %ignorecase directive for generating case-insensitive lexers by
00073      expanding matched character classes in a unicode-friendly way.
00074    Handle unmatched braces in quoted strings or comments within
00075      action code blocks.
00076    Fixed input lexer to allow whitespace in character classes, closing
00077      active bug #9.  Whitespace in quotes had been previously fixed.
00078    Made Yylex.YYEOF and %yyeof work like the manual says they should.
00079 
00080   Version 1.2.3, 6/26/97, [Raimondas Lencevicius]
00081    Fixed the yy_nxt[][] assignment that has generated huge code
00082    exceeding 64K method size limit. Now the assignment
00083    is handled by unpacking a string encoding of integer array.
00084    To achieve that, added
00085    "private int [][] unpackFromString(int size1, int size2, String st)"
00086    function and coded the yy_nxt[][] values into a string
00087    by printing integers into a string and representing
00088    integer sequences as "value:length" pairs.
00089    Improvement: generated .java file reduced 2 times, .class file
00090      reduced 6 times for sample grammar. No 64K errors.
00091    Possible negatives: Some editors and OSs may not be able to handle 
00092      the huge one-line generated string. String unpacking may be slower
00093      than direct array initialization.
00094 
00095   Version 1.2.2, 10/24/97, [Martin Dirichs]
00096   Notes:
00097     Changed yy_instream to yy_reader of type BufferedReader. This reflects
00098      the improvements in the JDK 1.1 concerning InputStreams. As a
00099      consequence, changed yy_buffer from byte[] to char[].
00100      The lexer can now be initialized with either an InputStream
00101      or a Reader. A third, private constructor is called by the other
00102      two to execute user specified constructor code.
00103 
00104   Version 1.2.1, 9/15/97 [A. Appel]
00105    Fixed bugs 6 (character codes > 127) and 10 (deprecated String constructor).
00106 
00107   Version 1.2, 5/5/97, [Elliot Berk]
00108   Notes:
00109     Simply changed the name from JavaLex to JLex.  No other changes.
00110 
00111   Version 1.1.5, 2/25/97, [Elliot Berk]
00112   Notes:
00113     Simple optimization to the creation of the source files.
00114      Added a BufferedOutputStream in the creation of the DataOutputStream
00115      field m_outstream of the class CLexGen.  This helps performance by
00116      doing some buffering, and was suggested by Max Hailperin,
00117      Associate Professor of Computer Science, Gustavus Adolphus College.
00118 
00119   Version 1.1.4, 12/12/96, [Elliot Berk]
00120   Notes:
00121     Added %public directive to make generated class public.
00122 
00123   Version 1.1.3, 12/11/96, [Elliot Berk]
00124   Notes:
00125     Converted assertion failure on invalid character class 
00126      when a dash '-' is not preceded with a start-of-range character.
00127      Converted this into parse error E_DASH.
00128 
00129   Version 1.1.2, October 30, 1996 [Elliot Berk]
00130     Fixed BitSet bugs by installing a BitSet class of my own,
00131      called JavaLexBitSet.  Fixed support for '\r', non-UNIX 
00132      sequences.  Added try/catch block around lexer generation
00133      in main routine to moderate error information presented 
00134      to user.  Fixed macro expansion, so that macros following 
00135      quotes are expanded correctly in regular expressions.
00136      Fixed dynamic reallocation of accept action buffers.
00137 
00138   Version 1.1.1, September 3, 1996 [Andrew Appel]
00139     Made the class "Main" instead of "JavaLex", 
00140      improved the installation instructions to reflect this.
00141 
00142   Version 1.1, August 15, 1996  [Andrew Appel]
00143     Made yychar, yyline, yytext global to the lexer so that
00144      auxiliary functions can access them.
00145   **************************************************************/

00220 class CSpec

00222   /***************************************************************
00223     Member Variables
00224     **************************************************************/
00225     
00226   /* Lexical States. */
00227   Hashtable m_states; /* Hashtable taking state indices (Integer) 
00228                          to state name (String). */
00229 
00230   /* Regular Expression Macros. */ 
00231   Hashtable m_macros; /* Hashtable taking macro name (String)
00232                                 to corresponding char buffer that
00233                                 holds macro definition. */
00234 
00235   /* NFA Machine. */
00236   CNfa m_nfa_start; /* Start state of NFA machine. */
00237   Vector m_nfa_states; /* Vector of states, with index
00238                                  corresponding to label. */
00239   
00240   Vector m_state_rules[]; /* An array of Vectors of Integers.
00241                                     The ith Vector represents the lexical state
00242                                     with index i.  The contents of the ith 
00243                                     Vector are the indices of the NFA start
00244                                     states that can be matched while in
00245                                     the ith lexical state. */
00246                                     
00247 
00248   int m_state_dtrans[];
00249 
00250   /* DFA Machine. */
00251   Vector m_dfa_states; /* Vector of states, with index
00252                                  corresponding to label. */
00253   Hashtable m_dfa_sets; /* Hashtable taking set of NFA states
00254                                   to corresponding DFA state, 
00255                                   if the latter exists. */
00256   
00257   /* Accept States and Corresponding Anchors. */
00258   Vector m_accept_vector;
00259   int m_anchor_array[];
00260 
00261   /* Transition Table. */
00262   Vector m_dtrans_vector;
00263   int m_dtrans_ncols;
00264   int m_row_map[];
00265   int m_col_map[];
00266 
00267   /* Special pseudo-characters for beginning-of-line and end-of-file. */
00268   static final int NUM_PSEUDO=2;
00269   int BOL; // beginning-of-line
00270   int EOF; // end-of-line
00271 
00273   int m_ccls_map[];
00274 
00275   /* Regular expression token variables. */
00276   int m_current_token;
00277   char m_lexeme;
00278   boolean m_in_quote;
00279   boolean m_in_ccl;
00280 
00281   /* Verbose execution flag. */
00282   boolean m_verbose;
00283

00285   boolean m_integer_type;
00286   boolean m_intwrap_type;
00287   boolean m_yyeof;
00288   boolean m_count_chars;
00289   boolean m_count_lines;
00290   boolean m_cup_compatible;

00342   /***************************************************************
00343     Function: CSpec
00344     Description: Constructor.
00345     **************************************************************/
00346   CSpec
00347     (
00348      CLexGen lexGen
00349      )
00350       {
00351         m_lexGen = lexGen;
00352 
00353         /* Initialize regular expression token variables. */
00354         m_current_token = m_lexGen.EOS;
00355         m_lexeme = '\0';
00356         m_in_quote = false;
00357         m_in_ccl = false;
00358 
00359         /* Initialize hashtable for lexer states. */
00360         m_states = new Hashtable();
00361         m_states.put(new String("YYINITIAL"),new Integer(m_states.size()));
00362 
00363         /* Initialize hashtable for lexical macros. */
00364         m_macros = new Hashtable();
00365 
00366         /* Initialize variables for lexer options. */
00367         m_integer_type = false;
00368         m_intwrap_type = false;
00369         m_count_lines = false;
00370         m_count_chars = false;
00371         m_cup_compatible = false;
00372         m_unix = true;
00373         m_public = false;
00374         m_yyeof = false;
00375         m_ignorecase = false;
00376 
00377         /* Initialize variables for JLex runtime options. */
00378         m_verbose = true;
00379 
00380         m_nfa_start = null;
00381         m_nfa_states = new Vector();
00382         
00383         m_dfa_states = new Vector();
00384         m_dfa_sets = new Hashtable();
00385 
00386         m_dtrans_vector = new Vector();
00387         m_dtrans_ncols = CUtility.MAX_SEVEN_BIT + 1;
00388         m_row_map = null;
00389         m_col_map = null;
00390 
00391         m_accept_vector = null;
00392         m_anchor_array = null;
00393 
00394         m_init_code = null;
00395         m_init_read = 0;
00396 
00397         m_init_throw_code = null;
00398         m_init_throw_read = 0;
00399 
00400         m_yylex_throw_code = null;
00401         m_yylex_throw_read = 0;
00402 
00403         m_class_code = null;
00404         m_class_read = 0;
00405 
00406         m_eof_code = null;
00407         m_eof_read = 0;
00408 
00409         m_eof_value_code = null;
00410         m_eof_value_read = 0;
00411 
00412         m_eof_throw_code = null;
00413         m_eof_throw_read = 0;
00414 
00415         m_state_dtrans = null;
00416 
00417         m_state_rules = null;
00418       }
00419 }

00457     Function: reset
00458     Description: Clears member variables.
00459     **************************************************************/

00461     (
00462      )

00465         m_outstream = null;
00466       }

00468   /***************************************************************
00469     Function: set
00470     Description: Initializes member variables.
00471     **************************************************************/
00472   private void set
00473     (
00474      CSpec spec,
00475      java.io.PrintWriter outstream
00476      )
00477       {
00478         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
00479           {
00480             CUtility.ASSERT(null != spec);
00481             CUtility.ASSERT(null != outstream);
00482           }
00483 
00484         m_spec = spec;
00485         m_outstream = outstream;
00486       }

00488   /***************************************************************
00489     Function: emit_imports
00490     Description: Emits import packages at top of 
00491     generated source file.
00492     **************************************************************/
00493   /*void emit_imports
00494     (
00495      CSpec spec,
00496      OutputStream outstream
00497      )
00498       throws java.io.IOException

00502           if (CUtility.DEBUG)

00507

00510           m_outstream.println("import java.io.BufferedReader;");

00515   
00516   /***************************************************************
00517     Function: print_details
00518     Description: Debugging output.
00519     **************************************************************/
00520   private void print_details
00521     (
00522      )
00523       {
00524         int i;
00525         int j;
00526         int next;
00527         int state;
00528         CDTrans dtrans;
00529         CAccept accept;
00530         boolean tr;
00531 
00532         System.out.println("---------------------- Transition Table " 
00533                            + "----------------------");
00534         
00535         for (i = 0; i < m_spec.m_row_map.length; ++i)
00536           {
00537             System.out.print("State " + i);
00538             
00539             accept = (CAccept) m_spec.m_accept_vector.elementAt(i);
00540             if (null == accept)
00541               {
00542                 System.out.println(" [nonaccepting]");
00543               }
00544             else
00545               {
00546                 System.out.println(" [accepting, line "
00547                                  + accept.m_line_number 
00548                                  + " <"
00549                                  + (new java.lang.String(accept.m_action,0,
00550                                                accept.m_action_read))
00551                                  + ">]");
00552               }
00553             dtrans = (CDTrans) m_spec.m_dtrans_vector.elementAt(m_spec.m_row_map[i]);
00554             
00555             tr = false;
00556             state = dtrans.m_dtrans[m_spec.m_col_map[0]];
00557             if (CDTrans.F != state)
00558               {
00559                 tr = true;
00560                 System.out.print("\tgoto " + state + " on [" + ((char) 0));
00561               }
00562             for (j = 1; j < m_spec.m_dtrans_ncols; ++j)
00563               {
00564                 next = dtrans.m_dtrans[m_spec.m_col_map[j]];
00565                 if (state == next)
00566                   {
00567                     if (CDTrans.F != state)
00568                       {
00569                         System.out.print((char) j);
00570                       }
00571                   }
00572                 else
00573                   {
00574                     state = next;
00575                     if (tr)
00576                       {
00577                         System.out.println("]");
00578                         tr = false;
00579                       }
00580                     if (CDTrans.F != state)
00581                       {
00582                         tr = true;
00583                         System.out.print("\tgoto " + state + " on [" + ((char) j));
00584                       }
00585                   }
00586               }
00587             if (tr)
00588               {
00589                 System.out.println("]");
00590               }
00591           }
00592 
00593         System.out.println("---------------------- Transition Table " 
00594                            + "----------------------");
00595       }
00596 
00597   /***************************************************************
00598     Function: emit
00599     Description: High-level access function to module.
00600     **************************************************************/
00601   void emit
00602     (
00603      CSpec spec,
00604      java.io.PrintWriter outstream
00605      )
00606       throws java.io.IOException      
00607         {
00608           set(spec,outstream);
00609           
00610           if (CUtility.DEBUG)
00611             {
00612               CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
00613               CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
00614             }
00615           
00616           if (CUtility.OLD_DEBUG) {
00617             print_details();
00618           }
00619 
00620           emit_header();
00621           emit_construct();
00622           emit_helpers();
00623           emit_driver();
00624           emit_footer();
00625           
00626           reset();
00627         }
00628 
00629   /***************************************************************
00630     Function: emit_construct
00631     Description: Emits constructor, member variables,
00632     and constants.
00633     **************************************************************/
00634   private void emit_construct
00635     (
00636      )
00637       throws java.io.IOException
00638         {
00639           if (CUtility.DEBUG)
00640           {
00641             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
00642             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
00643           }
00644           
00645           /* Constants */
00646           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_BUFFER_SIZE = 512;");
00647 
00648           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_F = -1;");
00649           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_NO_STATE = -1;");
00650 
00651           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_NOT_ACCEPT = 0;");
00652           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_START = 1;");
00653           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_END = 2;");
00654           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_NO_ANCHOR = 4;");
00655 
00656           // internal
00657           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_BOL = "+m_spec.BOL+";");
00658           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int YY_EOF = "+m_spec.EOF+";");
00659           // external
00660           if (m_spec.m_integer_type || true == m_spec.m_yyeof)
00661             m_outstream.println("\tpublic final int YYEOF = -1;");
00662

00664           if (null != m_spec.m_class_code)
00665             {
00666               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_class_code,0,
00667                                                 m_spec.m_class_read));
00668             }
00669

00672           m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_buffer_index;");
00673           m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_buffer_read;");
00674           m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_buffer_start;");
00675           m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_buffer_end;");

00678             {

00680             }
00681           if (m_spec.m_count_lines)
00682             {

00684             }

00687           /*if (m_spec.m_count_lines || true == m_spec.m_count_chars)
00688             {
00689               m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_buffer_prev_start;");
00690             }*/
00691           m_outstream.println();
00692

00696           if (true == m_spec.m_public) {
00697             m_outstream.print("public ");
00698           }

00707                                                 m_spec.m_init_throw_read));

00710             }

00712             {

00714             }

00717           m_outstream.println("\t\tif (null == reader) {");
00718           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tthrow (new Error(\"Error: Bad input "
00719                                  + "stream initializer.\"));");
00720           m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
00721           m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(reader);");
00722           m_outstream.println("\t}");

00730           }

00733

00735             {

00738               m_outstream.println(new String(m_spec.m_init_throw_code,0,

00750                                  + "stream initializer.\"));");

00761

00776           m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_buffer_read = 0;");

00778           m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_buffer_start = 0;");
00779           m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_buffer_end = 0;");

00781             {

00783             }

00799                                                 m_spec.m_init_read));

00807   /***************************************************************
00808     Function: emit_states
00809     Description: Emits constants that serve as lexical states,
00810     including YYINITIAL.
00811     **************************************************************/
00812   private void emit_states
00813     (
00814      )
00815       throws java.io.IOException
00816         {
00817           Enumeration states;
00818           String state;
00819           int index;
00820 
00821           states = m_spec.m_states.keys();
00822           /*index = 0;*/
00823           while (states.hasMoreElements())
00824             {
00825               state = (String) states.nextElement();
00826               
00827               if (CUtility.DEBUG)
00828                 {
00829                   CUtility.ASSERT(null != state);
00830                 }
00831               
00832               m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int " 
00833                                      + state 
00834                                      + " = " 
00835                                      + (m_spec.m_states.get(state)).toString() 
00836                                      + ";");
00837               /*++index;*/
00838             }
00839 
00840           m_outstream.println("\tprivate final int yy_state_dtrans[] = {");
00841           for (index = 0; index < m_spec.m_state_dtrans.length; ++index)
00842             {
00843               m_outstream.print("\t\t" + m_spec.m_state_dtrans[index]);
00844               if (index < m_spec.m_state_dtrans.length - 1)
00845                 {
00846                   m_outstream.println(",");
00847                 }
00848               else
00849                 {
00850                   m_outstream.println();
00851                 }
00852             }
00853           m_outstream.println("\t};");
00854         }

00911         /* Function: yy_advance */
00912         m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_advance ()");
00913         m_outstream.println("\t\tthrows java.io.IOException {");
00914         /*m_outstream.println("\t\t{");*/
00915         m_outstream.println("\t\tint next_read;");
00916         m_outstream.println("\t\tint i;");
00917         m_outstream.println("\t\tint j;");
00918         m_outstream.println();
00919 
00920         m_outstream.println("\t\tif (yy_buffer_index < yy_buffer_read) {");
00921         m_outstream.println("\t\t\treturn yy_buffer[yy_buffer_index++];");
00922         /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t++yy_buffer_index;");*/
00923         m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
00924         m_outstream.println();
00925 
00926         m_outstream.println("\t\tif (0 != yy_buffer_start) {");
00927         m_outstream.println("\t\t\ti = yy_buffer_start;");
00928         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tj = 0;");
00929         m_outstream.println("\t\t\twhile (i < yy_buffer_read) {");
00930         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_buffer[j] = yy_buffer[i];");
00931         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t++i;");
00932         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t++j;");
00933         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
00934         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_end = yy_buffer_end - yy_buffer_start;");
00935         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_start = 0;");
00936         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_read = j;");
00937         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_index = j;");
00938         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tnext_read = yy_reader.read(yy_buffer,");
00939         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_buffer_read,");
00940         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_buffer.length - yy_buffer_read);");
00941         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif (-1 == next_read) {");
00942         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\treturn YY_EOF;");
00943         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
00944         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_read = yy_buffer_read + next_read;");
00945         m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
00946         m_outstream.println();
00947 
00948         m_outstream.println("\t\twhile (yy_buffer_index >= yy_buffer_read) {");
00949         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif (yy_buffer_index >= yy_buffer.length) {");
00950         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_buffer = yy_double(yy_buffer);");
00951         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
00952         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tnext_read = yy_reader.read(yy_buffer,");
00953         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_buffer_read,");
00954         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_buffer.length - yy_buffer_read);");
00955         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif (-1 == next_read) {");
00956         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\treturn YY_EOF;");
00957         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
00958         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_read = yy_buffer_read + next_read;");
00959         m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
00960 
00961         m_outstream.println("\t\treturn yy_buffer[yy_buffer_index++];");
00962         m_outstream.println("\t}");
00963         
00964         /* Function: yy_move_end */
00965         m_outstream.println("\tprivate void yy_move_end () {");
00966         m_outstream.println("\t\tif (yy_buffer_end > yy_buffer_start &&");
00967         m_outstream.println("\t\t    '\\n' == yy_buffer[yy_buffer_end-1])");
00968         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_end--;");
00969         m_outstream.println("\t\tif (yy_buffer_end > yy_buffer_start &&");
00970         m_outstream.println("\t\t    '\\r' == yy_buffer[yy_buffer_end-1])");
00971         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_buffer_end--;");
00972         m_outstream.println("\t}");
00973 
00974         /* Function: yy_mark_start */
00975         m_outstream.println("\tprivate boolean yy_last_was_cr=false;");
00976         m_outstream.println("\tprivate void yy_mark_start () {");
00977         if (m_spec.m_count_lines || true == m_spec.m_count_chars)
00978           {
00979             if (m_spec.m_count_lines)
00980               {
00981                 m_outstream.println("\t\tint i;");
00982                 m_outstream.println("\t\tfor (i = yy_buffer_start; " 
00983                                        + "i < yy_buffer_index; ++i) {");
00984                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif ('\\n' == yy_buffer[i] && !yy_last_was_cr) {");
00985                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t++yyline;");
00986                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
00987                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif ('\\r' == yy_buffer[i]) {");
00988                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t++yyline;");
00989                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_last_was_cr=true;");
00990                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\t} else yy_last_was_cr=false;");
00991                 m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
00992               }
00993             if (m_spec.m_count_chars)
00994               {
00995                 m_outstream.println("\t\tyychar = yychar"); 
00996                 m_outstream.println("\t\t\t+ yy_buffer_index - yy_buffer_start;");
00997               }
00998           }
00999         m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_buffer_start = yy_buffer_index;");
01000         m_outstream.println("\t}");
01001 
01002         /* Function: yy_mark_end */
01003         m_outstream.println("\tprivate void yy_mark_end () {");
01004         m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_buffer_end = yy_buffer_index;");
01005         m_outstream.println("\t}");
01006 
01007         /* Function: yy_to_mark */
01008         m_outstream.println("\tprivate void yy_to_mark () {");
01009         m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_buffer_index = yy_buffer_end;");
01010         m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_at_bol = "+
01011                             "(yy_buffer_end > yy_buffer_start) &&");
01012         m_outstream.println("\t\t            "+
01013                             "('\\r' == yy_buffer[yy_buffer_end-1] ||");
01014         m_outstream.println("\t\t            "+
01015                             " '\\n' == yy_buffer[yy_buffer_end-1] ||");
01016         m_outstream.println("\t\t            "+ /* unicode LS */
01017                             " 2028/*LS*/ == yy_buffer[yy_buffer_end-1] ||");
01018         m_outstream.println("\t\t            "+ /* unicode PS */
01019                             " 2029/*PS*/ == yy_buffer[yy_buffer_end-1]);");
01020         m_outstream.println("\t}");

01039         m_outstream.println("\t\tfor (i = 0; i < buf.length; ++i) {");
01040         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tnewbuf[i] = buf[i];");
01041         m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
01042         m_outstream.println("\t\treturn newbuf;");
01043         m_outstream.println("\t}");

01071         // Function: private int [][] unpackFromString(int size1, int size2, String st)
01072         // Added 6/24/98 Raimondas Lencevicius
01073         // May be made more efficient by replacing String operations
01074         // Assumes correctly formed input String. Performs no error checking
01075         m_outstream.println("\tprivate int[][] unpackFromString"+
01076                             "(int size1, int size2, String st) {");
01077         m_outstream.println("\t\tint colonIndex = -1;");
01078         m_outstream.println("\t\tString lengthString;");
01079         m_outstream.println("\t\tint sequenceLength = 0;");
01080         m_outstream.println("\t\tint sequenceInteger = 0;");
01081         m_outstream.println();
01082         m_outstream.println("\t\tint commaIndex;");
01083         m_outstream.println("\t\tString workString;");
01084         m_outstream.println();
01085         m_outstream.println("\t\tint res[][] = new int[size1][size2];");
01086         m_outstream.println("\t\tfor (int i= 0; i < size1; i++) {");
01087         m_outstream.println("\t\t\tfor (int j= 0; j < size2; j++) {");
01088         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tif (sequenceLength != 0) {");
01089         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tres[i][j] = sequenceInteger;");
01090         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tsequenceLength--;");
01091         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tcontinue;");
01092         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t}");
01093         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tcommaIndex = st.indexOf(',');");
01094         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tworkString = (commaIndex==-1) ? st :");
01095         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tst.substring(0, commaIndex);");
01096         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tst = st.substring(commaIndex+1);");  
01097         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tcolonIndex = workString.indexOf(':');");
01098         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tif (colonIndex == -1) {");
01099         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tres[i][j]=Integer.parseInt(workString);");
01100         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tcontinue;");
01101         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t}");
01102         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tlengthString =");
01103         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tworkString.substring(colonIndex+1);");
01104         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tsequenceLength="+
01105                             "Integer.parseInt(lengthString);");
01106         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tworkString="+
01107                             "workString.substring(0,colonIndex);");
01108         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tsequenceInteger="+
01109                             "Integer.parseInt(workString);");
01110         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tres[i][j] = sequenceInteger;");
01111         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tsequenceLength--;");
01112         m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
01113         m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
01114         m_outstream.println("\t\treturn res;");
01115         m_outstream.println("\t}");
01116       }
01117 
01118   /***************************************************************
01119     Function: emit_header
01120     Description: Emits class header.
01121     **************************************************************/
01122   private void emit_header
01123     (
01124      )
01125       throws java.io.IOException
01126       {
01127         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
01128           {
01129             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
01130             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
01131           }
01132 
01133         m_outstream.println();
01134         m_outstream.println();
01135         if (true == m_spec.m_public) {
01136           m_outstream.print("public ");
01137         }
01138         m_outstream.print("class ");
01139         m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_class_name,0,
01140                                           m_spec.m_class_name.length));
01141         if (m_spec.m_implements_name.length > 0) {
01142            m_outstream.print(" implements ");   
01143            m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_implements_name,0,
01144                                           m_spec.m_implements_name.length));
01145         }         
01146         m_outstream.println(" {");
01147       }
01148 
01149   /***************************************************************
01150     Function: emit_table
01151     Description: Emits transition table.
01152     **************************************************************/
01153   private void emit_table
01154     (
01155      )
01156       throws java.io.IOException
01157       {
01158         int i;
01159         int elem;
01160         int size;
01161         CDTrans dtrans;
01162         boolean is_start;
01163         boolean is_end;
01164         CAccept accept;
01165 
01166         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
01167           {
01168             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
01169             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
01170           }
01171 
01172         m_outstream.println("\tprivate int yy_acpt[] = {");
01173         size = m_spec.m_accept_vector.size();
01174         for (elem = 0; elem < size; ++elem)
01175           {
01176             accept = (CAccept) m_spec.m_accept_vector.elementAt(elem);
01177             
01178             m_outstream.print("\t\t/* "+elem+" */ ");
01179             if (null != accept)
01180               {
01181                 is_start = (0 != (m_spec.m_anchor_array[elem] & CSpec.START));
01182                 is_end = (0 != (m_spec.m_anchor_array[elem] & CSpec.END));
01183                 
01184                 if (is_start && true == is_end)
01185                   {
01186                     m_outstream.print("YY_START | YY_END");
01187                   }
01188                 else if (is_start)
01189                   {
01190                     m_outstream.print("YY_START");
01191                   }
01192                 else if (is_end)
01193                   {
01194                     m_outstream.print("YY_END");
01195                   }
01196                 else
01197                   {
01198                     m_outstream.print("YY_NO_ANCHOR");
01199                   }
01200               }
01201             else 
01202               {
01203                 m_outstream.print("YY_NOT_ACCEPT");
01204               }
01205             
01206             if (elem < size - 1)
01207               {
01208                 m_outstream.print(",");
01209               }
01210             
01211             m_outstream.println();
01212           }
01213         m_outstream.println("\t};");
01214 
01215         // CSA: modified yy_cmap to use string packing 9-Aug-1999
01216         int[] yy_cmap = new int[m_spec.m_ccls_map.length];
01217         for (i = 0; i < m_spec.m_ccls_map.length; ++i)
01218             yy_cmap[i] = m_spec.m_col_map[m_spec.m_ccls_map[i]];
01219         m_outstream.print("\tprivate int yy_cmap[] = unpackFromString(");
01220         emit_table_as_string(new int[][] { yy_cmap });
01221         m_outstream.println(")[0];");
01222         m_outstream.println();
01223 
01224         // CSA: modified yy_rmap to use string packing 9-Aug-1999
01225         m_outstream.print("\tprivate int yy_rmap[] = unpackFromString(");
01226         emit_table_as_string(new int[][] { m_spec.m_row_map });
01227         m_outstream.println(")[0];");
01228         m_outstream.println();
01229 
01230         // 6/24/98 Raimondas Lencevicius
01231         // modified to use
01232         //    int[][] unpackFromString(int size1, int size2, String st)
01233         size = m_spec.m_dtrans_vector.size();
01234         int[][] yy_nxt = new int[size][];
01235         for (elem=0; elem<size; elem++) {
01236             dtrans = (CDTrans) m_spec.m_dtrans_vector.elementAt(elem);
01237             CUtility.ASSERT(dtrans.m_dtrans.length==m_spec.m_dtrans_ncols);
01238             yy_nxt[elem] = dtrans.m_dtrans;
01239         }
01240         m_outstream.print
01241           ("\tprivate int yy_nxt[][] = unpackFromString(");
01242         emit_table_as_string(yy_nxt);
01243         m_outstream.println(");");
01244         m_outstream.println();
01245       }
01246 
01247   /***************************************************************
01248     Function: emit_driver
01249     Description: Output an integer table as a string.  Written by
01250     Raimondas Lencevicius 6/24/98; reorganized by CSA 9-Aug-1999.
01251     From his original comments:
01252            yy_nxt[][] values are coded into a string
01253            by printing integers and representing
01254            integer sequences as "value:length" pairs.
01255     **************************************************************/
01256   private void emit_table_as_string(int[][] ia) {
01257         int sequenceLength = 0; // RL - length of the number sequence
01258         boolean sequenceStarted = false; // RL - has number sequence started?
01259         int previousInt = -20; // RL - Bogus -20 state.
01260         
01261         // RL - Output matrix size
01262         m_outstream.print(ia.length);
01263         m_outstream.print(",");
01264         m_outstream.print(ia.length>0?ia[0].length:0);
01265         m_outstream.println(",");
01266 
01267         StringBuffer outstr = new StringBuffer();
01268 
01269         //  RL - Output matrix 
01270         for (int elem = 0; elem < ia.length; ++elem)
01271           {
01272             for (int i = 0; i < ia[elem].length; ++i)
01273               {
01274                 int writeInt = ia[elem][i];
01275                 if (writeInt == previousInt) // RL - sequence?
01276                   {
01277                     if (sequenceStarted)
01278                       {
01279                         sequenceLength++;
01280                       }
01281                     else
01282                       {
01283                         outstr.append(writeInt);
01284                         outstr.append(":");
01285                         sequenceLength = 2;
01286                         sequenceStarted = true;
01287                       }
01288                   }
01289                 else // RL - no sequence or end sequence
01290                   {
01291                     if (sequenceStarted)
01292                       {
01293                         outstr.append(sequenceLength);
01294                         outstr.append(",");
01295                         sequenceLength = 0;
01296                         sequenceStarted = false;
01297                       }
01298                     else
01299                       {
01300                         if (previousInt != -20)
01301                           {
01302                             outstr.append(previousInt);
01303                             outstr.append(",");
01304                           }
01305                       }
01306                   }
01307                 previousInt = writeInt;
01308                 // CSA: output in 75 character chunks.
01309                 if (outstr.length() > 75) {
01310                   String s = outstr.toString();
01311                   m_outstream.println("\""+s.substring(0,75)+"\" +");
01312                   outstr = new StringBuffer(s.substring(75));
01313                 }
01314               }
01315           }
01316         if (sequenceStarted)
01317           {
01318             outstr.append(sequenceLength);
01319           }
01320         else
01321           {
01322             outstr.append(previousInt);
01323           }    
01324         // CSA: output in 75 character chunks.
01325         if (outstr.length() > 75) {
01326           String s = outstr.toString();
01327           m_outstream.println("\""+s.substring(0,75)+"\" +");
01328           outstr = new StringBuffer(s.substring(75));
01329         }
01330         m_outstream.print("\""+outstr+"\"");
01331   }
01332 
01333   /***************************************************************
01334     Function: emit_driver
01335     Description: 
01336     **************************************************************/
01337   private void emit_driver
01338     (
01339      )
01340       throws java.io.IOException
01341         {
01342           if (CUtility.DEBUG)
01343             {
01344               CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
01345               CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
01346             }
01347           
01348           emit_table();
01349 
01350           if (m_spec.m_integer_type)
01351             {
01352               m_outstream.print("\tpublic int ");
01353               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_function_name));
01354               m_outstream.println(" ()");
01355             }
01356           else if (m_spec.m_intwrap_type)
01357             {
01358               m_outstream.print("\tpublic java.lang.Integer ");
01359               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_function_name));
01360               m_outstream.println(" ()");
01361             }
01362           else
01363             {
01364               m_outstream.print("\tpublic ");
01365               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_type_name));
01366               m_outstream.print(" ");
01367               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_function_name));
01368               m_outstream.println(" ()");
01369             }
01370 
01371           /*m_outstream.println("\t\tthrows java.io.IOException {");*/
01372           m_outstream.print("\t\tthrows java.io.IOException");
01373           if (null != m_spec.m_yylex_throw_code)
01374             {
01375               m_outstream.print(", "); 
01376               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_yylex_throw_code,0,
01377                                                 m_spec.m_yylex_throw_read));
01378               m_outstream.println();
01379               m_outstream.println("\t\t{");
01380             }
01381           else
01382             {
01383               m_outstream.println(" {");
01384             }
01385 
01386           m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_lookahead;");
01387           m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_anchor = YY_NO_ANCHOR;");
01388           /*m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_state "
01389             + "= yy_initial_dtrans(yy_lexical_state);");*/
01390           m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_state " 
01391                                  + "= yy_state_dtrans[yy_lexical_state];");
01392           m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_next_state = YY_NO_STATE;");
01393           /*m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_prev_stave = YY_NO_STATE;");*/
01394           m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_last_accept_state = YY_NO_STATE;");
01395           m_outstream.println("\t\tboolean yy_initial = true;");
01396           m_outstream.println("\t\tint yy_this_accept;");
01397           m_outstream.println();
01398 
01399           m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_mark_start();");
01400           /*m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_accept(yy_state);");*/
01401           m_outstream.println("\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_acpt[yy_state];");
01402           m_outstream.println("\t\tif (YY_NOT_ACCEPT != yy_this_accept) {");
01403           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_last_accept_state = yy_state;");
01404           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_mark_end();");
01405           m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
01406 
01407           if (NOT_EDBG)
01408             {
01409               m_outstream.println("\t\tjava.lang.System.out.println(\"Begin\");");
01410             }
01411 
01412           m_outstream.println("\t\twhile (true) {");
01413 
01414           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif (yy_initial && yy_at_bol) "+
01415                                          "yy_lookahead = YY_BOL;");
01416           m_outstream.println("\t\t\telse yy_lookahead = yy_advance();");
01417           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_next_state = YY_F;");
01418           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_next_state = "
01419                                  + "yy_next(yy_state,yy_lookahead);");*/
01420           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tyy_next_state = "
01421            + "yy_nxt[yy_rmap[yy_state]][yy_cmap[yy_lookahead]];");
01422 
01423           if (NOT_EDBG)
01424             {
01425               m_outstream.println("java.lang.System.out.println(\"Current state: \"" 
01426                                      + " + yy_state");
01427               m_outstream.println("+ \"\tCurrent input: \""); 
01428               m_outstream.println(" + ((char) yy_lookahead));");
01429             }
01430           if (NOT_EDBG)
01431             {
01432               m_outstream.println("\t\t\tjava.lang.System.out.println(\"State = \"" 
01433                                      + "+ yy_state);");
01434               m_outstream.println("\t\t\tjava.lang.System.out.println(\"Accepting status = \"" 
01435                                      + "+ yy_this_accept);");
01436               m_outstream.println("\t\t\tjava.lang.System.out.println(\"Last accepting state = \"" 
01437                                      + "+ yy_last_accept_state);");
01438               m_outstream.println("\t\t\tjava.lang.System.out.println(\"Next state = \"" 
01439                                      + "+ yy_next_state);");
01440               m_outstream.println("\t\t\tjava.lang.System.out.println(\"Lookahead input = \"" 
01441                                      + "+ ((char) yy_lookahead));");
01442             }
01443 
01444           // handle bare EOF.
01445           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif (YY_EOF == yy_lookahead " 
01446                                  + "&& true == yy_initial) {");
01447           if (null != m_spec.m_eof_code)
01448             {
01449               m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_do_eof();");
01450             }
01451           if (true == m_spec.m_integer_type)
01452             {
01453               m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\treturn YYEOF;");
01454             }
01455           else if (null != m_spec.m_eof_value_code) 
01456             {
01457               m_outstream.print(new String(m_spec.m_eof_value_code,0,
01458                                                 m_spec.m_eof_value_read));
01459             }
01460           else
01461             {
01462               m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\treturn null;");
01463             }
01464           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
01465 
01466           m_outstream.println("\t\t\tif (YY_F != yy_next_state) {");
01467           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_state = yy_next_state;");
01468           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_initial = false;");
01469           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_accept(yy_state);");*/
01470           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_acpt[yy_state];");
01471           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tif (YY_NOT_ACCEPT != yy_this_accept) {");
01472           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_last_accept_state = yy_state;");
01473           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_mark_end();");
01474           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t}");
01475           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_prev_state = yy_state;");*/
01476           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tyy_state = yy_next_state;");*/
01477           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
01478 
01479           m_outstream.println("\t\t\telse {");
01480           
01481           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\tif (YY_NO_STATE == yy_last_accept_state) {");
01482           
01483 
01484           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_error(YY_E_MATCH,false);");
01485           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_initial = true;");
01486           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_state "
01487                                  + "= yy_state_dtrans[yy_lexical_state];");
01488           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_next_state = YY_NO_STATE;");*/
01489           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_prev_state = YY_NO_STATE;");*/
01490           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_last_accept_state = YY_NO_STATE;");
01491           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_mark_start();");*/
01492           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_accept(yy_state);");*/
01493           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_acpt[yy_state];");
01494           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tif (YY_NOT_ACCEPT != yy_this_accept) {");
01495           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t\tyy_last_accept_state = yy_state;");
01496           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t}");*/
01497 
01498           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tthrow (new Error(\"Lexical Error: Unmatched Input.\"));");
01499           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t}");
01500 
01501           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\telse {");
01502 
01503           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_anchor = yy_acpt[yy_last_accept_state];");
01504           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_anchor " 
01505             + "= yy_accept(yy_last_accept_state);");*/
01506           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tif (0 != (YY_END & yy_anchor)) {");
01507           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t\tyy_move_end();");
01508           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t}");
01509           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_to_mark();");
01510 
01511           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tswitch (yy_last_accept_state) {");
01512 
01513           emit_actions("\t\t\t\t\t");
01514 
01515           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tdefault:");
01516           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t\tyy_error(YY_E_INTERNAL,false);");
01517           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t\treturn null;");*/
01518           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tcase -1:");
01519           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t}");
01520           
01521           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_initial = true;");
01522           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_state "
01523                                  + "= yy_state_dtrans[yy_lexical_state];");
01524           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_next_state = YY_NO_STATE;");
01525           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_prev_state = YY_NO_STATE;");*/
01526           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_last_accept_state = YY_NO_STATE;");
01527 
01528           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_mark_start();");
01529 
01530           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_accept(yy_state);");*/
01531           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tyy_this_accept = yy_acpt[yy_state];");
01532           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\tif (YY_NOT_ACCEPT != yy_this_accept) {");
01533           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t\tyy_last_accept_state = yy_state;");
01534           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t\tyy_mark_end();");
01535           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t\t}");
01536 
01537           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t}");       
01538           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t}");
01539           m_outstream.println("\t\t}");
01540           m_outstream.println("\t}");
01541 
01542           /*m_outstream.println("\t\t\t\t");
01543           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t");
01544           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t");
01545           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t");
01546           m_outstream.println("\t\t\t");
01547           m_outstream.println("\t\t}");*/
01548         }
01549   
01550   /***************************************************************
01551     Function: emit_actions
01552     Description:     
01553     **************************************************************/
01554   private void emit_actions 
01555     (
01556      String tabs
01557      )
01558       throws java.io.IOException
01559         {
01560           int elem;
01561           int size;
01562           int bogus_index;
01563           CAccept accept;
01564           
01565           if (CUtility.DEBUG)
01566             {
01567               CUtility.ASSERT(m_spec.m_accept_vector.size() 
01568                               == m_spec.m_anchor_array.length);
01569             }
01570 
01571           bogus_index = -2;
01572           size = m_spec.m_accept_vector.size();
01573           for (elem = 0; elem < size; ++elem)
01574             {
01575               accept = (CAccept) m_spec.m_accept_vector.elementAt(elem);
01576               if (null != accept) 
01577                 {
01578                   m_outstream.println(tabs + "case " + elem 
01579                                          + ":");
01580                   m_outstream.print(tabs + "\t");
01581                   m_outstream.print(new String(accept.m_action,0,
01582                                                     accept.m_action_read));
01583                   m_outstream.println();
01584                   m_outstream.println(tabs + "case " + bogus_index + ":");
01585                   m_outstream.println(tabs + "\tbreak;");
01586                   --bogus_index;
01587                 }
01588             }
01589         }
01590   
01591   /***************************************************************
01592     Function: emit_footer
01593     Description:     
01594     **************************************************************/
01595   private void emit_footer
01596     (
01597      )
01598       throws java.io.IOException
01599       {
01600         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
01601           {
01602             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
01603             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
01604           }
01605 
01606         m_outstream.println("}");
01607       }
01608 }
01609 
01610 /***************************************************************
01611   Class: CBunch
01612   **************************************************************/
01613 class CBunch
01614 {
01615   /***************************************************************
01616     Member Variables
01617     **************************************************************/
01618   Vector m_nfa_set; /* Vector of CNfa states in dfa state. */
01619   SparseBitSet m_nfa_bit; /* BitSet representation of CNfa labels. */
01620   CAccept m_accept; /* Accepting actions, or null if nonaccepting state. */
01621   int m_anchor; /* Anchors on regular expression. */
01622   int m_accept_index; /* CNfa index corresponding to accepting actions. */
01623 
01624   /***************************************************************
01625     Function: CBunch
01626     Description: Constructor.
01627     **************************************************************/
01628   CBunch
01629     (
01630      )
01631       {
01632         m_nfa_set = null;
01633         m_nfa_bit = null;
01634         m_accept = null;
01635         m_anchor = CSpec.NONE;
01636         m_accept_index = -1;
01637       }
01638 }
