03940   /***************************************************************
03941     Function: CAccept
03942     **************************************************************/
03943   CAccept
03944     (
03945      char action[],
03946      int action_read,
03947      int line_number
03948      )
03949       {
03950         int elem;
03951 
03952         m_action_read = action_read;
03953 
03954         m_action = new char[m_action_read];
03955         for (elem = 0; elem < m_action_read; ++elem)
03956           {
03957             m_action[elem] = action[elem];
03958           }
03959 
03960         m_line_number = line_number;
03961       }
03962 
03963   /***************************************************************
03964     Function: CAccept
03965     **************************************************************/
03966   CAccept
03967     (
03968      CAccept accept
03969      )
03970       {
03971         int elem;
03972 
03973         m_action_read = accept.m_action_read;
03974         
03975         m_action = new char[m_action_read];
03976         for (elem = 0; elem < m_action_read; ++elem)
03977           {
03978             m_action[elem] = accept.m_action[elem];
03979           }
03980 
03981         m_line_number = accept.m_line_number;
03982       }
03983

03985     Function: mimic
03986     **************************************************************/

03988     (
03989      CAccept accept
03990      )
03991       {

03993 
03994         m_action_read = accept.m_action_read;
03995         
03996         m_action = new char[m_action_read];
03997         for (elem = 0; elem < m_action_read; ++elem)
03998           {
03999             m_action[elem] = accept.m_action[elem];
04000           }
04001       }

04050 /***************************************************************
04051   Class: CInput
04052   Description: 
04053  **************************************************************/
04054 class CInput
04055 {
04056   /***************************************************************
04057     Member Variables
04058     **************************************************************/
04059   private java.io.BufferedReader m_input; /* JLex specification file. */
04060 
04061   boolean m_eof_reached; /* Whether EOF has been encountered. */
04062   boolean m_pushback_line; 
04063 
04064   char m_line[]; /* Line buffer. */
04065   int m_line_read; /* Number of bytes read into line buffer. */
04066   int m_line_index; /* Current index into line buffer. */
04067 
04068   int m_line_number; /* Current line number. */
04069 
04070   /***************************************************************
04071     Constants
04072     **************************************************************/
04073   static final boolean EOF = true;
04074   static final boolean NOT_EOF = false;
04075   
04076   /***************************************************************
04077     Function: CInput
04078     Description: 
04079     **************************************************************/
04080   CInput
04081     (
04082      java.io.Reader input
04083      )
04084       {
04085         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
04086           {
04087             CUtility.ASSERT(null != input);
04088           }
04089 
04090         /* Initialize input stream. */
04091         m_input = new java.io.BufferedReader(input);
04092 
04093         /* Initialize buffers and index counters. */
04094         m_line = null;
04095         m_line_read = 0;
04096         m_line_index = 0;
04097 
04098         /* Initialize state variables. */
04099         m_eof_reached = false;
04100         m_line_number = 0;
04101         m_pushback_line = false;
04102       }
04103 
04104   /***************************************************************
04105     Function: getLine
04106     Description: Returns true on EOF, false otherwise.
04107     Guarantees not to return a blank line, or a line
04108     of zero length.
04109     **************************************************************/
04110   boolean getLine 
04111     (
04112      )
04113       throws java.io.IOException
04114       {
04115         String lineStr;
04116         int elem;
04117         
04118         /* Has EOF already been reached? */
04119         if (m_eof_reached)
04120           {
04121             return EOF;
04122           }
04123         
04124         /* Pushback current line? */
04125         if (m_pushback_line)
04126           {
04127             m_pushback_line = false;
04128 
04129             /* Check for empty line. */
04130             for (elem = 0; elem < m_line_read; ++elem)
04131               {
04132                 if (false == CUtility.isspace(m_line[elem]))
04133                   {
04134                     break;
04135                   }
04136               }
04137 
04138             /* Nonempty? */
04139             if (elem < m_line_read)
04140               {
04141                 m_line_index = 0;
04142                 return NOT_EOF;
04143               }
04144           }
04145 
04146         while (true)
04147           {
04148             if (null == (lineStr = m_input.readLine()))
04149               {
04150                 m_eof_reached = true;
04151                 m_line_index = 0;
04152                 return EOF;
04153               }
04154             m_line = (lineStr + "\n").toCharArray();
04155             m_line_read=m_line.length;
04156             ++m_line_number;
04157             
04158             /* Check for empty lines and discard them. */
04159             elem = 0;
04160             while (CUtility.isspace(m_line[elem])) 
04161               {
04162                 ++elem;
04163                 if (elem == m_line_read)
04164                   {
04165                     break;
04166                   }
04167               }
04168             
04169             if (elem < m_line_read)
04170               {
04171                 break;
04172               }
04173           }
04174 
04175         m_line_index = 0;
04176         return NOT_EOF;
04177       }
04178 }
04179

04257   /***************************************************************
04258     Function: doubleSize
04259     **************************************************************/
04260   static char[] doubleSize
04261     (
04262      char oldBuffer[]
04263      )
04264       {
04265         char newBuffer[] = new char[2 * oldBuffer.length];
04266         int elem;
04267 
04268         for (elem = 0; elem < oldBuffer.length; ++elem)
04269           {
04270             newBuffer[elem] = oldBuffer[elem];
04271           }
04272 
04273         return newBuffer;
04274       }

04282      )

04284         byte newBuffer[] = new byte[2 * oldBuffer.length];
04285         int elem;
04286 
04287         for (elem = 0; elem < oldBuffer.length; ++elem)
04288           {

04290           }

04295   /********************************************************
04296     Function: hex2bin
04297     *******************************************************/
04298   static char hex2bin
04299     (
04300      char c
04301      )
04302       {
04303         if ('0' <= c && '9' >= c)
04304           {
04305             return (char) (c - '0');
04306           }
04307         else if ('a' <= c && 'f' >= c)
04308           {
04309             return (char) (c - 'a' + 10);
04310           }         
04311         else if ('A' <= c && 'F' >= c)
04312           {
04313             return (char) (c - 'A' + 10);
04314           }
04315         
04316         CError.impos("Bad hexidecimal digit" + c);
04317         return 0;
04318       }
04319 
04320   /********************************************************
04321     Function: ishexdigit
04322     *******************************************************/
04323   static boolean ishexdigit
04324     (
04325      char c
04326      )
04327       {
04328         if (('0' <= c && '9' >= c)
04329             || ('a' <= c && 'f' >= c)
04330             || ('A' <= c && 'F' >= c))
04331           {
04332             return true;
04333           }
04334 
04335         return false;
04336       }
04337 
04338   /********************************************************
04339     Function: oct2bin
04340     *******************************************************/
04341   static char oct2bin
04342     (
04343      char c
04344      )
04345       {
04346         if ('0' <= c && '7' >= c)
04347           {
04348             return (char) (c - '0');
04349           }
04350         
04351         CError.impos("Bad octal digit " + c);
04352         return 0;
04353       }
04354 
04355   /********************************************************
04356     Function: isoctdigit
04357     *******************************************************/
04358   static boolean isoctdigit
04359     (
04360      char c
04361      )
04362       {
04363         if ('0' <= c && '7' >= c)
04364           {
04365             return true;
04366           }
04367 
04368         return false;
04369       }
04370         
04371   /********************************************************
04372     Function: isspace
04373     *******************************************************/
04374   static boolean isspace
04375     (
04376      char c
04377      )
04378       {
04379         if ('\b' == c 
04380             || '\t' == c
04381             || '\n' == c
04382             || '\f' == c
04383             || '\r' == c
04384             || ' ' == c)
04385           {
04386             return true;
04387           }
04388         
04389         return false;
04390       }
04391 
04392   /********************************************************
04393     Function: isnewline
04394     *******************************************************/
04395   static boolean isnewline
04396     (
04397      char c
04398      )
04399       {
04400         if ('\n' == c
04401             || '\r' == c)
04402             {
04403             return true;
04404           }
04405         
04406         return false;
04407       }
04408 
04409   /********************************************************
04410     Function: bytencmp
04411     Description: Compares up to n elements of 
04412     byte array a[] against byte array b[].
04413     The first byte comparison is made between 
04414     a[a_first] and b[b_first].  Comparisons continue
04415     until the null terminating byte '\0' is reached
04416     or until n bytes are compared.
04417     Return Value: Returns 0 if arrays are the 
04418     same up to and including the null terminating byte 
04419     or up to and including the first n bytes,
04420     whichever comes first.
04421     *******************************************************/
04422   static int bytencmp
04423     (
04424      byte a[],
04425      int a_first,
04426      byte b[],
04427      int b_first,
04428      int n
04429      )
04430       {
04431         int elem;
04432 
04433         for (elem = 0; elem < n; ++elem)
04434           {
04435             /*System.out.print((char) a[a_first + elem]);
04436             System.out.print((char) b[b_first + elem]);*/
04437                              
04438             if ('\0' == a[a_first + elem] && '\0' == b[b_first + elem])
04439               {
04440                 /*System.out.println("return 0");*/
04441                 return 0;
04442               }
04443             if (a[a_first + elem] < b[b_first + elem])
04444               {
04445                 /*System.out.println("return 1");*/
04446                 return 1;
04447               }
04448             else if (a[a_first + elem] > b[b_first + elem])
04449               {
04450                 /*System.out.println("return -1");*/
04451                 return -1;
04452               }
04453           }
04454 
04455         /*System.out.println("return 0");*/
04456         return 0;
04457       }
04458 
04459   /********************************************************
04460     Function: charncmp
04461     *******************************************************/
04462   static int charncmp
04463     (
04464      char a[],
04465      int a_first,
04466      char b[],
04467      int b_first,
04468      int n
04469      )
04470       {
04471         int elem;
04472 
04473         for (elem = 0; elem < n; ++elem)
04474           {
04475             if ('\0' == a[a_first + elem] && '\0' == b[b_first + elem])
04476               {
04477                 return 0;
04478               }
04479             if (a[a_first + elem] < b[b_first + elem])
04480               {
04481                 return 1;
04482               }
04483             else if (a[a_first + elem] > b[b_first + elem])
04484               {
04485                 return -1;
04486               }
04487           }
04488 
04489         return 0;
04490       }
04491 }
04492

04584 /********************************************************
04585   Class: CSet
04586   *******************************************************/
04587 class CSet 
04588 {
04589   /********************************************************
04590     Member Variables
04591     *******************************************************/
04592   private SparseBitSet m_set;
04593   private boolean m_complement;
04594 
04595   /********************************************************
04596     Function: CSet
04597     *******************************************************/
04598   CSet
04599     (
04600      )
04601     {
04602       m_set = new SparseBitSet();
04603       m_complement = false;
04604     }
04605 
04606   /********************************************************
04607     Function: complement
04608     *******************************************************/
04609   void complement
04610     (
04611      )
04612       {
04613         m_complement = true;
04614       }
04615 
04616   /********************************************************
04617     Function: add
04618     *******************************************************/
04619   void add
04620     (
04621      int i
04622      )
04623       {
04624         m_set.set(i);
04625       }
04626 
04627   /********************************************************
04628     Function: addncase
04629     *******************************************************/
04630   void addncase // add, ignoring case.
04631     (
04632      char c
04633      )
04634       {
04635         /* Do this in a Unicode-friendly way. */
04636         /* (note that duplicate adds have no effect) */
04637         add(c);
04638         add(Character.toLowerCase(c));
04639         add(Character.toTitleCase(c));
04640         add(Character.toUpperCase(c));
04641       }
04642   
04643   /********************************************************
04644     Function: contains
04645     *******************************************************/
04646   boolean contains
04647     (
04648      int i
04649      )
04650       {
04651         boolean result;
04652         
04653         result = m_set.get(i);
04654         
04655         if (m_complement)
04656           {
04657             return (false == result);
04658           }
04659         
04660         return result;
04661       }
04662 
04663   /********************************************************
04664     Function: mimic
04665     *******************************************************/
04666   void mimic
04667     (
04668      CSet set
04669      )
04670       {
04671         m_complement = set.m_complement;
04672         m_set = (SparseBitSet) set.m_set.clone();
04673       } 
04674 
04676   void map(CSet set, int[] mapping) {
04677     m_complement = set.m_complement;
04678     m_set.clearAll();
04679     for (Enumeration e=set.m_set.elements(); e.hasMoreElements(); ) {
04680       int old_value =((Integer)e.nextElement()).intValue();
04681       if (old_value<mapping.length) // skip unmapped characters
04682         m_set.set(mapping[old_value]);
04683     }
04684   }
04685 }
04686 
04687 /********************************************************
04688   Class: CNfa
04689   *******************************************************/
04690 class CNfa
04691 {
04692   /********************************************************
04693     Member Variables
04694     *******************************************************/
04695   int m_edge;  /* Label for edge type:
04696                          character code, 
04697                          CCL (character class), 
04698                          [STATE,
04699                          SCL (state class),]
04700                          EMPTY, 
04701                          EPSILON. */
04702   
04703   CSet m_set;  /* Set to store character classes. */
04704   CNfa m_next;  /* Next state (or null if none). */
04705   
04706   CNfa m_next2;  /* Another state with type == EPSILON
04707                            and null if not used.  
04708                            The NFA construction should result in two
04709                            outgoing edges only if both are EPSILON edges. */
04710   
04711   CAccept m_accept;  /* Set to null if nonaccepting state. */
04712   int m_anchor;  /* Says if and where pattern is anchored. */
04713 
04714   int m_label;
04715 
04716   SparseBitSet m_states;
04717 
04718   /********************************************************
04719     Constants
04720     *******************************************************/
04721   static final int NO_LABEL = -1;
04722 
04723   /********************************************************
04724     Constants: Edge Types
04725     Note: Edge transitions on one specific character
04726     are labelled with the character Ascii (Unicode)
04727     codes.  So none of the constants below should
04728     overlap with the natural character codes.
04729     *******************************************************/
04730   static final int CCL = -1;
04731   static final int EMPTY = -2;
04732   static final int EPSILON = -3;
04733    
04734   /********************************************************
04735     Function: CNfa
04736     *******************************************************/
04737  CNfa
04738     (
04739      )
04740     {
04741       m_edge = EMPTY;
04742       m_set = null;
04743       m_next = null;
04744       m_next2 = null;
04745       m_accept = null;
04746       m_anchor = CSpec.NONE;
04747       m_label = NO_LABEL;
04748       m_states = null;
04749     }
04750 
04751   /********************************************************
04752     Function: mimic
04753     Description: Converts this NFA state into a copy of
04754     the input one.
04755     *******************************************************/
04756   void mimic
04757     (
04758      CNfa nfa
04759      )
04760       {
04761         m_edge = nfa.m_edge;
04762         
04763         if (null != nfa.m_set)
04764           {
04765             if (null == m_set)
04766               {
04767                 m_set = new CSet();
04768               }
04769             m_set.mimic(nfa.m_set);
04770           }
04771         else
04772           {
04773             m_set = null;
04774           }
04775 
04776         m_next = nfa.m_next;
04777         m_next2 = nfa.m_next2;
04778         m_accept = nfa.m_accept;
04779         m_anchor = nfa.m_anchor;
04780 
04781         if (null != nfa.m_states)
04782           {
04783             m_states = (SparseBitSet) nfa.m_states.clone();
04784           }
04785         else
04786           {
04787             m_states = null;
04788           }
04789       }
04790 }
04791 
04792 /***************************************************************
04793   Class: CLexGen
04794   **************************************************************/
04795 class CLexGen 
04796 {
04797   /***************************************************************
04798     Member Variables
04799     **************************************************************/
04800   private java.io.Reader m_instream; /* JLex specification file. */
04801   private java.io.PrintWriter m_outstream; /* Lexical analyzer source file. */
04802 
04803   private CInput m_input; /* Input buffer class. */
04804 
04805   private Hashtable m_tokens; /* Hashtable that maps characters to their 
04806                                  corresponding lexical code for
04807                                  the internal lexical analyzer. */
04808   private CSpec m_spec; /* Spec class holds information
04809                            about the generated lexer. */
04810   private boolean m_init_flag; /* Flag set to true only upon 
04811                                   successful initialization. */
04812 
04813   private CMakeNfa m_makeNfa; /* NFA machine generator module. */
04814   private CNfa2Dfa m_nfa2dfa; /* NFA to DFA machine (transition table) 
04815                                  conversion module. */
04816   private CMinimize m_minimize; /* Transition table compressor. */
04817   private CSimplifyNfa m_simplifyNfa; /* NFA simplifier using char classes */
04818   private CEmit m_emit; /* Output module that emits source code
04819                            into the generated lexer file. */
04820 
04821 
04822   /********************************************************
04823     Constants
04824     *******************************************************/
04825   private static final boolean ERROR = false;
04826   private static final boolean NOT_ERROR = true;
04827   private static final int BUFFER_SIZE = 1024;
04828 
04829   /********************************************************
04830     Constants: Token Types
04831     *******************************************************/
04832   static final int EOS = 1;
04833   static final int ANY = 2;
04834   static final int AT_BOL = 3;
04835   static final int AT_EOL = 4;
04836   static final int CCL_END = 5;
04837   static final int CCL_START = 6;
04838   static final int CLOSE_CURLY = 7;
04839   static final int CLOSE_PAREN = 8;
04840   static final int CLOSURE = 9;
04841   static final int DASH = 10;
04842   static final int END_OF_INPUT = 11;
04843   static final int L = 12;
04844   static final int OPEN_CURLY = 13;
04845   static final int OPEN_PAREN = 14;
04846   static final int OPTIONAL = 15;
04847   static final int OR = 16;
04848   static final int PLUS_CLOSE = 17;
04849 
04850   /***************************************************************
04851     Function: CLexGen
04852     **************************************************************/
04853   CLexGen 
04854     (
04855      String filename
04856      )
04857       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
04858       {
04859         /* Successful initialization flag. */
04860         m_init_flag = false;
04861         
04862         /* Open input stream. */
04863         m_instream = new java.io.FileReader(filename);
04864         if (null == m_instream)
04865           {
04866             System.out.println("Error: Unable to open input file "
04867                                + filename + ".");
04868             return;
04869           }
04870 
04871         /* Open output stream. */
04872         m_outstream 
04873           = new java.io.PrintWriter(new java.io.BufferedWriter(
04874                 new java.io.FileWriter(filename + ".java")));
04875         if (null == m_outstream)
04876           {
04877             System.out.println("Error: Unable to open output file "
04878                                + filename + ".java.");
04879             return;
04880           }
04881 
04882         /* Create input buffer class. */
04883         m_input = new CInput(m_instream);
04884 
04885         /* Initialize character hash table. */
04886         m_tokens = new Hashtable();
04887         m_tokens.put(new Character('$'),new Integer(AT_EOL));
04888         m_tokens.put(new Character('('),new Integer(OPEN_PAREN));
04889         m_tokens.put(new Character(')'),new Integer(CLOSE_PAREN));
04890         m_tokens.put(new Character('*'),new Integer(CLOSURE));
04891         m_tokens.put(new Character('+'),new Integer(PLUS_CLOSE));
04892         m_tokens.put(new Character('-'),new Integer(DASH));
04893         m_tokens.put(new Character('.'),new Integer(ANY));
04894         m_tokens.put(new Character('?'),new Integer(OPTIONAL));
04895         m_tokens.put(new Character('['),new Integer(CCL_START));
04896         m_tokens.put(new Character(']'),new Integer(CCL_END));
04897         m_tokens.put(new Character('^'),new Integer(AT_BOL));
04898         m_tokens.put(new Character('{'),new Integer(OPEN_CURLY));
04899         m_tokens.put(new Character('|'),new Integer(OR));
04900         m_tokens.put(new Character('}'),new Integer(CLOSE_CURLY));
04901       
04902         /* Initialize spec structure. */
04903         m_spec = new CSpec(this);
04904         
04905         /* Nfa to dfa converter. */
04906         m_nfa2dfa = new CNfa2Dfa();
04907         m_minimize = new CMinimize();
04908         m_makeNfa = new CMakeNfa();
04909         m_simplifyNfa = new CSimplifyNfa();
04910 
04911         m_emit = new CEmit();
04912 
04913         /* Successful initialization flag. */
04914         m_init_flag = true;
04915       }
04916 
04917   /***************************************************************
04918     Function: generate
04919     Description: 
04920     **************************************************************/
04921   void generate
04922     (
04923      )
04924       throws java.io.IOException, java.io.FileNotFoundException
04925       {
04926         if (false == m_init_flag)
04927           {
04928             CError.parse_error(CError.E_INIT,0);
04929           }
04930 
04931         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
04932           {
04933             CUtility.ASSERT(null != this);
04934             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
04935             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_input);
04936             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_tokens);
04937             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
04938             CUtility.ASSERT(m_init_flag);
04939           }
04940 
04941         /*m_emit.emit_imports(m_spec,m_outstream);*/
04942 
04943         if (m_spec.m_verbose)
04944           {
04945             System.out.println("Processing first section -- user code.");
04946           }
04947         userCode();
04948         if (m_input.m_eof_reached)
04949           {
04950             CError.parse_error(CError.E_EOF,m_input.m_line_number);
04951           }
04952 
04953         if (m_spec.m_verbose)
04954           {
04955             System.out.println("Processing second section -- " 
04956                                + "JLex declarations.");
04957           }
04958         userDeclare();
04959         if (m_input.m_eof_reached)
04960           {
04961             CError.parse_error(CError.E_EOF,m_input.m_line_number);
04962           }
04963 
04964         if (m_spec.m_verbose)
04965           {
04966             System.out.println("Processing third section -- lexical rules.");
04967           }
04968         userRules();
04969         if (CUtility.DO_DEBUG)
04970           {
04971             print_header();
04972           }
04973 
04974         if (m_spec.m_verbose)
04975           {
04976             System.out.println("Outputting lexical analyzer code.");
04977           }
04978         m_emit.emit(m_spec,m_outstream);
04979 
04980         if (m_spec.m_verbose && true == CUtility.OLD_DUMP_DEBUG)
04981           {
04982             details();
04983           }
04984         
04985         m_outstream.close();
04986       }
04987 
04988   /***************************************************************
04989     Function: userCode
04990     Description: Process first section of specification,
04991     echoing it into output file.
04992     **************************************************************/
04993   private void userCode
04994     (
04995      )
04996       throws java.io.IOException
04997       {
04998         int count = 0;
04999 
05000         if (false == m_init_flag)
05001           {
05002             CError.parse_error(CError.E_INIT,0);
05003           }
05004 
05005         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
05006           {
05007             CUtility.ASSERT(null != this);
05008             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_outstream);
05009             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_input);
05010             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_tokens);
05011             CUtility.ASSERT(null != m_spec);
05012           }
05013 
05014         if (m_input.m_eof_reached)
05015           {
05016             CError.parse_error(CError.E_EOF,0);
05017           }
05018 
05019         while (true)
05020           {
05021             if (m_input.getLine())
05022               {
05023                 /* Eof reached. */
05024                 CError.parse_error(CError.E_EOF,0);
05025               }
05026             
05027             if (2 <= m_input.m_line_read 
05028                 && '%' == m_input.m_line[0]
05029                 && '%' == m_input.m_line[1])
05030               {
05031                 /* Discard remainder of line. */
05032                 m_input.m_line_index = m_input.m_line_read;
05033                 return;
05034               }
05035 
05036             m_outstream.print(new String(m_input.m_line,0,
05037                                               m_input.m_line_read));
05038           }
05039       }
05040 
05041   /***************************************************************
05042     Function: getName
05043     **************************************************************/
05044   private char[] getName
05045     (
05046      )
05047       {
05048         char buffer[];
05049         int elem;
05050 
05051         /* Skip white space. */
05052         while (m_input.m_line_index < m_input.m_line_read
05053                && true == CUtility.isspace(m_input.m_line[m_input.m_line_index]))
05054           {
05055             ++m_input.m_line_index;
05056           }
05057 
05058         /* No name? */
05059         if (m_input.m_line_index >= m_input.m_line_read)
05060           {
05061             CError.parse_error(CError.E_DIRECT,0);
05062           }
05063 
05064         /* Determine length. */
05065         elem = m_input.m_line_index;
05066         while (elem < m_input.m_line_read
05067                && false == CUtility.isnewline(m_input.m_line[elem]))
05068           {
05069             ++elem;
05070           } 
05071 
05072         /* Allocate non-terminated buffer of exact length. */
05073         buffer = new char[elem - m_input.m_line_index];
05074         
05075         /* Copy. */
05076         elem = 0;
05077         while (m_input.m_line_index < m_input.m_line_read
05078                && false == CUtility.isnewline(m_input.m_line[m_input.m_line_index]))
05079           {
05080             buffer[elem] = m_input.m_line[m_input.m_line_index];
05081             ++elem;
05082             ++m_input.m_line_index;
05083           }
05084 
05085         return buffer;
05086       }
05087 
05088   private final int CLASS_CODE = 0;
05089   private final int INIT_CODE = 1;
05090   private final int EOF_CODE = 2;
05091   private final int INIT_THROW_CODE = 3;
05092   private final int YYLEX_THROW_CODE = 4;
05093   private final int EOF_THROW_CODE = 5;
05094   private final int EOF_VALUE_CODE = 6;
05095 
05096   /***************************************************************
05097     Function: packCode
05098     Description:
05099     **************************************************************/
05100   private char[] packCode
05101     (
05102      char start_dir[],
05103      char end_dir[],
05104      char prev_code[],
05105      int prev_read,
05106      int specified
05107      )
05108       throws java.io.IOException
05109       {
05110         if (CUtility.DEBUG)
05111           {
05112             CUtility.ASSERT(INIT_CODE == specified 
05113                             || CLASS_CODE == specified
05114                             || EOF_CODE == specified
05115                             || EOF_VALUE_CODE == specified
05116                             || INIT_THROW_CODE == specified
05117                             || YYLEX_THROW_CODE == specified
05118                             || EOF_THROW_CODE == specified);
05119           }
05120 
05121         if (0 != CUtility.charncmp(m_input.m_line,
05122                                    0,
05123                                    start_dir,
05124                                    0,
05125                                    start_dir.length - 1))
05126           {
05127             CError.parse_error(CError.E_INTERNAL,0);
05128           }
05129         
05130         if (null == prev_code)
05131           {
05132             prev_code = new char[BUFFER_SIZE];
05133             prev_read = 0;
05134           }
05135         
05136         if (prev_read >= prev_code.length)
05137           {
05138             prev_code = CUtility.doubleSize(prev_code);
05139           }
05140         
05141         m_input.m_line_index = start_dir.length - 1;
05142         while (true)
05143           {
05144             while (m_input.m_line_index >= m_input.m_line_read)
05145               {
05146                 if (m_input.getLine())
05147                   {
05148                     CError.parse_error(CError.E_EOF,m_input.m_line_number);
05149                   }
05150                 
05151                 if (0 == CUtility.charncmp(m_input.m_line,
05152                                            0,
05153                                            end_dir,
05154                                            0,
05155                                            end_dir.length - 1))
05156                   {
05157                     m_input.m_line_index = end_dir.length - 1;
05158                     
05159                     switch (specified)
05160                       {
05161                       case CLASS_CODE:
05162                         m_spec.m_class_read = prev_read;
05163                         break;
05164                         
05165                       case INIT_CODE:
05166                         m_spec.m_init_read = prev_read;
05167                         break;
05168                         
05169                       case EOF_CODE:
05170                         m_spec.m_eof_read = prev_read;
05171                         break;
05172 
05173                       case EOF_VALUE_CODE:
05174                         m_spec.m_eof_value_read = prev_read;
05175                         break;
05176 
05177                       case INIT_THROW_CODE:
05178                         m_spec.m_init_throw_read = prev_read;
05179                         break;
05180 
05181                       case YYLEX_THROW_CODE:
05182                         m_spec.m_yylex_throw_read = prev_read;
05183                         break;
05184                         
05185                       case EOF_THROW_CODE:
05186                         m_spec.m_eof_throw_read = prev_read;
05187                         break;
05188                         
05189                       default:
05190                         CError.parse_error(CError.E_INTERNAL,m_input.m_line_number);
05191                         break;
05192                       }
05193 
05194                     return prev_code;
05195                   }
05196               }
05197 
05198             while (m_input.m_line_index < m_input.m_line_read)
05199               {
05200                 prev_code[prev_read] = m_input.m_line[m_input.m_line_index];
05201                 ++prev_read;
05202                 ++m_input.m_line_index;
05203 
05204                 if (prev_read >= prev_code.length)
05205                   {
05206                     prev_code = CUtility.doubleSize(prev_code);
05207                   }
05208               }
05209           }
05210       }
